messages.title: Theresa May - Strong and Stable Leadership
messages.content: I am proud to have been a part of Theresa May’s leadership election team and to have been a loyal supporter ever since. When I voted to Remain in the EU, I did so largely because I believed we’d be given a clear instruction by the people to leave the EU and I have accepted this instruction. I’m the only candidate in this election serving in the Coalface of government in Theresa May’s team. This local election is about which candidate can support the best possible deal from Brexit. Simon Kirby, standing with Theresa May, will mean a vote for Jeremy Corbyn.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: With a strong negotiating hand I can deliver for you and for Britain by securing growth and prosperity.
Campaigning for $486 million of Government funding for the Royal Sussex County hospital redevelopment.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Millions of Pounds of Government Funding
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Secured $486 million for Royal Sussex County Hospital, $2.4 million to help complete redevelopment of Preston Barracks, $12 million for University using local economic plan funding.

issues.brexitEurope: My Lancaster House Speech setting out our 12-point plan for Brexit. The Government’s Official White Paper on Brexit. The UK’s Article 50 Letter to the President of the European Council. The Great Repeal Bill to ensure a smooth and orderly Brexit.
issues.economy: Build a stronger economy that rewards people who work hard and creates secure and well-paid jobs. There will be more investment and growth opportunities.
issues.government: I campaigned long and hard for the $486 million of Government funding for the Royal Sussex County hospital redevelopment. This is my major development focus for Stronger Britain with a Global Plan.
issues.health: Provide real opportunity and security for all and secure the future of the NHS.

community.content: Millions of Pounds of Government Funding - My local Conservative team deserves this success. We were part of the plan involving local suppression.

examples: $486 million of Government funding for the Royal Sussex County hospital
$12 million for University using local economic plan funding
